page.title: 09The Timber Yard
page.content: If you drive through Allithwaite you cannot miss{Knipe's woodyard,}in the centre of the village. Here you will find skilled craftsmen making parts for houses and specialist items. Mr.Knipe and his men have made many items for local churches, such as new doors for Cartmel Priory,an altar, tables, font cover and doors for the church in Allithwaite.The largest item made was a waterwheel. The yard has its own 'tradesmans' mark which is carved onto a finished piece.The mark is a small snail. Although timber comes from local forests,much is imported from Russia, Brazil.Sweden,Africa and Canada. The business has been handed down in the family and Mr.Knipe hopes that his son will continue the tradition.
